ext_globalsymbol.h

00001 #ifndef __GLOBALSYMBOL_H__
00002 #define __GLOBALSYMBOL_H__
00003 
00004 // private
00005 void globalsymbol_initclass();
00006 
00007 
00008 /** Get a reference to an object that is bound to a #t_symbol.
00009     @ingroup misc
00010     @param  x           The object that is getting the reference to the symbol.
00011     @param  name        The name of the symbol to reference.
00012     @param  classname   The name of the class of which the object we are referencing should be an instance.
00013     @return             The s_thing of the #t_symbol.
00014     
00015     @remark             An example of real-world use is to get the buffer~ object associated with a symbol.
00016     @code
00017     // the struct of our object
00018     typedef struct _myobject {
00019         t_object    obj;
00020         t_symbol    *buffer_name;
00021         t_buffer    *buffer_object;
00022     } t_myobject;
00023     
00024     void myobject_setbuffer(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00025     {       
00026         if(s != x->buffer_name){
00027             // Reference the buffer associated with the incoming name
00028             x->buffer_object = (t_buffer *)globalsymbol_reference((t_object *)x, s->s_name, "buffer~");
00029             
00030             // If we were previously referenceing another buffer, we should not longer reference it.
00031             globalsymbol_dereference((t_object *)x, x->buffer_name->s_name, "buffer~");
00032             
00033             x->buffer_name = s;
00034         }       
00035     }
00036     @endcode
00037 */
00038 void *globalsymbol_reference(t_object *x, char *name, char *classname);
00039 
00040 
00041 /** Stop referencing an object that is bound to a #t_symbol, previously referenced using globalsymbol_reference().
00042     @ingroup misc
00043     @param  x           The object that is getting the reference to the symbol.
00044     @param  name        The name of the symbol to reference.
00045     @param  classname   The name of the class of which the object we are referencing should be an instance.
00046     @see    globalsymbol_reference()
00047 */
00048 void globalsymbol_dereference(t_object *x, char *name, char *classname);
00049 
00050 
00051 /** Bind an object to a #t_symbol.
00052     @ingroup misc
00053     @param  x       The object to bind to the #t_symbol.
00054     @param  name    The name of the #t_symbol to which the object will be bound.
00055     @param  flags   Pass 0.
00056     @return     A Max error code.
00057 */
00058 t_max_err globalsymbol_bind(t_object *x, char *name, long flags);
00059 
00060 
00061 /** Remove an object from being bound to a #t_symbol.
00062     @ingroup misc
00063     @param  x       The object from which to unbind the #t_symbol.
00064     @param  name    The name of the #t_symbol from which the object will be unbound.
00065     @param  flags   Pass 0.
00066 */
00067 void globalsymbol_unbind(t_object *x, char *name, long flags);
00068 
00069 
00070 // private
00071 void globalsymbol_notify(t_object *x, char *name, t_symbol *msg, void *data);
00072 
00073 
00074 #endif // __GLOBALSYMBOL_H__
